update.description:
This pull request is split from pull request #111. It is used to move  a model in 3d space by setting the linear velocity of its links. 

## Dependencies:
* ign-physics [pull request #46](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/46)
update.title: Move3d system
update.reason: This will require an ign-physics feature to be reworked. I'm closing this since it is not needed right now. Will reopen when the physics feature is imlemented.

content.raw: I believe this is under discussion in the [ign-physics PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/46/wip-add-link-features/activity#comment-87417733)
content.html: I believe this is under discussion in the ign-physics PR

content.raw: this applies linear velocity in local frame right? What if one of the links is rotated?
content.html: this applies linear velocity in local frame right? What if one of the links is rotated?

content.raw: This works for me. It would be interesting to add a demo world with some quick-start instructions similar to [the diff drive one](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/9c94f60787a277ec94afe7af274cbb4949357398/examples/worlds/diff_drive.sdf?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#diff_drive.sdf-2)
content.html: This works for me. It would be interesting to add a demo world with some quick-start instructions similar to the diff drive one

content.raw: This is used by a few tests, we should move it to a common place, maybe something like `TestUtils.hh` (in the future)
content.html: This is used by a few tests, we should move it to a common place, maybe something like TestUtils.hh (in the future)

content.raw: All functions and classes are missing the `//////////////////////////////////////////////////` in front of them
content.html: All functions and classes are missing the ////////////////////////////////////////////////// in front of them

This is already checked above.

Also, consider just returning when there are no new messages (to reduce indentation), i.e.:

    if (!this->dataPtr->linearVelCmd.has_value())
      return;

content.raw: It would be good to print an error that the system won't work.
content.html: It would be good to print an error that the system won't work.

content.raw: So far, other topics have followed the pattern `<entity_type>/<entity_name>/...`, such as `world/default/scene/info` and `model/vehicle/cmd_vel`. How to you feel about changing this to be similar?
content.html: So far, other topics have followed the pattern <entity_type>/<entity_name>/..., such as world/default/scene/info and model/vehicle/cmd_vel. How to you feel about changing this to be similar?
